abstract.text: Keys that specify attachments to individual samples in a buffer.

inlineContent.text: You can get and set sample-level attachments in a sample buffer using the

abstract.text: Represent time-based audio-visual assets with essential data types.
Retrieves an array of sample attachment dictionaries that represents each sample in a sample buffer.
An object that contains zero or more media samples of a uniform media type.
Indicates whether the sample depends on other samples for decoding (type
Indicates whether the sample should be displayed immediately (type
, default false).
Indicates whether the sample should be decoded but not displayed (type
, default false).
Indicates whether later samples may have earlier display times (type
Indicates whether the sample has redundant coding (type
Indicates whether other samples depend on this sample for decoding (type
Indicates whether the sample is a sync sample (type
, default false).
Indicates whether the sample is a partial sync sample (type
, default false).
Tells that the empty marker should be dequeued immediately regardless of its timestamp (type
, default false).
Indicates whether the sample buffer should be drained after decoding type
, default false).
Indicates the reason the current video frame was dropped (type
Indicates additional information regarding the dropped video frame (type
Marks an intentionally empty interval in the sequence of samples (type
, default false).
Indicates that sample buffer’s decode timestamp may be used to define the previous sample buffer’s duration (type
, default false).
Fill the difference between discontiguous sample buffers with silence (type
, default false).
Indicates that the current or next video sample buffer should be forced to be encoded as a key frame.
Indicates the decoder refresh count (type
Marks the end of the sequence of samples (type
, default false).
If present, indicates that decode pipelines should post a notification when consuming the sample buffer(type
Indicates whether the sample buffer should be reset before decoding (type
, default false).
If present, indicates that output should be resumed following a discontinuity
, default false).
Indicates that the decoded contents of the sample buffer should be reversed (type

Indicates the URL where the sample data is (type
The factor by which the sample buffer’s presentation should be accelerated (type
, default 1.0).
Indicates information about the lens stabilization applied to the current still image buffer.
Marks a transition from one source of buffers to another.
The duration that should be removed at the end of the sample buffer, after decoding.
The duration that should be removed at the beginning of the sample buffer, after decoding.
A discontinuity was caused by a camera mode switch.
An unknown number of frames were dropped.
The frame was dropped because it was late.
The frame was dropped because the module providing frames is out of buffers.
The lens stabilization module was active for the duration this buffer.
The lens stabilization module was not used during this capture.
The motion of the device or duration of the capture was outside of what the stabilization mechanism could support.
The lens stabilization module was unavailable for use.
